content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Great, time consuming fun.  Physics engine has been improved over FS 11 and FS 13.  I tested it out by crashing into everything at full speeds and into other vehicles being driven by the AI and I do not go flying up into the air, twirling about and getting stuck upside down anymore!For anyone who says driving is like "being on ice", when you have a heavy load or trailer connected to your tractor, attach a weight to the front.  It will weight it down and stop the sliding.  The issue is that you have all that weight on the back so when you turn at speed the front end lifts a little bit and you lose traction.Ive played FS11 and FS13 and this is so far better than either.  Only downside is that 1 map is new and 1 map is the American town from the FS13 Titanium Expansion.  But that's no issue to me, there's some great modders and world creators out there so I look forward to them and official DLC from Giants.   9.5/10  (-.5 for reusing an old map in a new game)

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2014
												English:A true successor to the series, although I must admit I am somewhat disappointed. It is still as addictive, but it is also still more of a leasure game rather than a simulator. They did manage to combine both Farming Simulator and Woodcutter Simulator into 1 game...but I'm not so sure how I feel about that...The player takes on the role of a farmer, with substantial equipment and monetary resources already available as you start. As you try to make money you will find that it is pretty hard to go bankrupt, and before you know it you have the fields and equipment that justify the huge farm complex that you start off with. Then you notice that your equipment is getting dirty, which is a great addition to the game, even though it is only a visual effect and does not affect the way equipment is handling.I have stated in previous versions how the game could really become a proper Farming Simulator, and I have read similar comments in the forums and from other players since, but apparently the developers haven't picked up on that; There is no crop disease, so whatever you put into the ground, it will come out healthy and ready to harvest, always. There is no soil quality, it is always in mint condition and the only purpose for manure and sprayers is to double / triple the yield. On top of that, you start off with a rediculous large farm complex that isnt justified by the 1 - 3 fields you also start off with.The community has made some interesting mods that solve some of these problems, but I'd rather see them in the vanilla game.For those that are familiar with the previous versions, here are some nuisances you'll encounter:First off, remember the PDA? That little device in the bottom-left corner of the screen that showed you a map, demand, livestock info and all that? Ya, you now have to press I which will open an screen and pause the game. This is not much of a problem per se, but do you also remember the phones, where you can get information about just about anything, like a manual? When you interact with that you get a similar screen, but the game continues on the background. Which means that if you don't have the equipment to do something while your crops are growing, you will either have to go on a long strawl or read every page at the payphone; No more checking demand, livestock, etc while you watch your favourite handyman take the wheel of your combine...All in all a good game, but in my opinion it still does not live up to its name, and the developers seem to have other things on their minds than adding more interesting game mechanics.Dispite all of this ranting I cannot help but give this a thumbs up, because it is true to its legacy, addictive as hell, and it looks great without ruining the game (hint to Egosoft).-------------------------------------------------------------Nederlands:Een waardige opvolger van de serie, hoewel ik to moet geven dat ik enigszins teleurgesteld ben. Het is nog steeds verslavend, maar ook meer een nutteloos tijdsverdrijf dan een echte simulator. Ze hebben het voor elkaar gekregen om Farming Simulator samen te voegen met hun Woodcutter Simulator...maar ik weet niet hoe ik daar over denk op dit moment...De speler stapt in de rol van een boer, met veel werktuigen en financiele bronnen beschikbaar al vanaf dat je begint. Terwijl je probeert wat geld te verdienen kom je er snel achter dat het moeilijk is om failliet te gaan, en voor je het weet heb je de velden en de werktuigen die passen bij het formaat van je erf en de gebouwen die er al sinds het begin staan. Dan valt het je op dat je werktuigen vies worden, een goeie toevoeging aan het spel, hoewel dit slechts esthetisch is en geen enkele werking heeft op de werktuigen.Ik heb in recencies van vorige versies al aangegeven hoe het spel een echte Farming Simulator kan worden, en ik heb sindsdien soortgelijke opmerkingen in forums en recensies van andere spelers gezien, maar blijkbaar hebben de ontwikkelaars daar niets mee gedaan; Je planten kunnen niet ziek worden, dus wat je ook in de grond stopt, het komt er altijd kerngezond uit. Er is geen grondkwaliteit, het is altijd in perfecte staat en het enige doel van de mest en sproeiers is het verdubbelen / verdrievoudigen van je oogst. Daar komt nog bij dat je met een belachelijk grote boerderij begint die niet overeen komt met de 1-3 velden waarme je begint.Er zijn een aantal interessante mods gemaakt door de spelers die veel van deze problemen oplossen, maar ik zou het spel liever aangepast zien worden zodat het niet nodig zou zijn.Voor hen die bekend zijn met de vorige versies, hier zijn wat irritaties die je tegen zult komen:Ten eerste, ken je de PDA nog? Dat kleine apparaatje links ondering je scherm waarop je de kaart, prijzen, je veestapel enzo kon vinden? Ja, die is dus weg. Nu moet je op I drukken om een venster te zien waar datzelfde beschikbaar is, alleen wordt het spel gepauzeerd. Dit is niet per se een probleem, maar herinner je je de telefoons nog waar je informatie over alles kon vinden als een soort handleiding? Als je daar nu gebruik van maakt krijg je een soortgelijk scherm, maar het spel blijft op de achtergrond doorgaan. Dit betekent dat als je geen werktuigen hebt om jezelf mee te vermaken terwijl je velden aan het bloeien zijn je je of dood verveelt terwijl je wacht, een lange wandeling moet gaan maken of elke pagina in de telefoon moet gaan lezen; Niet meer kijken wat de huidige prijzen zijn of het voedsel niveau van je veestapel controleren terwijl je je favoriete knecht achter het stuur van je combine laat.Al met al een goed spel, maar naar mijn mening is het nog steeds de naam niet waardig, en de ontwikkelaars hebben iets anders aan hun hoofd dat interessante spel mechaniek.Ondanks al dit geklaag kan ik het niet helpen dit product aan te raden, omdat het in de lijn van de serie valt, verslavend als wat is en er grafisch geweldig uitziet zonder dat dat ten koste gaat van het spel (hint naar Egosoft).

number of helpful: 14 of 27 people (52%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												I am utterly perplexed by the thousands of positive reviews for this game, I suppose I must be missing something. For me, this is probably one of the most boring games I have ever played, and I play Train Simulator. Your gameplay options consist of plowing a field, planting seeds in a field, watering a field, harvesting a field, washing a tractor or collecting eggs by walking over them like Super Mario. I understand there are other things you can do like chop down trees and cut the grass and such but to be honest I found the whole experience so mind numbingly boring that I just can't bring myself to play it enough to discover these features. I bought this game with a friend under the assumption we would be building our own farm from scratch and then trading our stock with other farms and so on. In actual fact the farm is already pre made and all you do is plow the fields, then sell your stock in the town by dumping it in a pile next to the buyer's building - very realistic. Your business decisions will involve should I sell my corn to the train station (???) or the biogas farm (spoiler - it makes no difference).  Online play consists of plowing the same fields with other people helping which of course means you can plow more fields, faster. This will enable you to earn money to buy more fields that you can plow which will make you more money so that you can buy more tractors to plow the fields. As I mentioned earlier you can also seed, water and harvest the field but unfortunately all these actions involve driving on the field in a straight line so there really isn't any difference. If you like farming, I would recommend getting a job as a farmer. If you like having neck and shoulder ache and holding down W while watching a tractor drive in a straight line then I would recommend getting this game.

Posted: April 13, 2015
												If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

												It is difficult to understand just what holds you to this game for hour upon hour, with now over 2000 hours gameplay on Farm Simulator 2013 this version for 2015 is even better. When my family ask me what the attraction is I can't explain why I'm hooked. The physics is noticable straight away in 15 and the graphics have been updated too. Perhaps it is for me just a way to relax after the end of a day, but I still find myself working out the best to make a profit, but as the Sun sets and the Moon begins to rise I end the day standing on my farm cottage porch admiring the view.Now where did I put that pipe.

												For all that are unfamiliar to the francis, in Farming Simulator you get a closer look in to the life of a farmer, like in real life the more work you put in to this game the more profit you will earn and with the money you can upgrade you farming equipment and buy more fields to run an even bigger profit and expand your farm. Keeping in mind that this isn't a triple A title, and they only ask 30$ as release price, knowing that i find that Gaints has done a great job in creating this game, it may not run on the same level of graphic like other games like Destiny or Diablo 3, but i think in over haul it looks fine as it is, simple but fun. So in the end it's all up to your preference if you gon like this game or not, it's not a story based game casual.What's new in fs15? The biggest thing will be the foresting, you now have a new way to make money by chopping wood. The next thing you gone notice is the upgrade in graphics, everything looks more polished then in FS13. Then there is more realisme added to the game, where weights are more important and to pull off a large trailer you may need a stronger tractor, then there is a power issue where a cheap tractor won't operate two pieces of equipment at the same time, so when buying a new tractor at the shop you really need to ask your self what you gone use it for. And yes!!! you now have the option to turn on/off the withering of crops, and you get rear view mirrors, nicely done Gaints thank you for listening to your customers.Now there are some low points to this game, not that they are game breaking but who knows maybe Giants read this review and acts on it and if not then at least a review must give it all right? *There is a new PDA system and its full screen, the game pauses and if you are used of playing FS13 you know how handy it was to drive and check the pda at the same time for prices or demands, well you can't anymore. *Missions, the got a new system now where you have to walk to a board and check if there are any missions you may want to do, sadly enough this can be annoying if your waiting for that one mowing mission or for a demand to popup, cause you have to leg it each time to the nearest mission bord.*Screen tearing, seams Giants forgot to add Vsync, now if your good with pc's then you can change that in your graphic card settings but not everyone is a computer wizard and a option in game can really make a difference.I was hoping for some Ski Simulator in FS15 but maybe Giants is holding that for there next installment who know, anyway the game feels addictive like all previous farming games and by the time i get bored with the vanilla game i am sure i can look forward to many mods to breath new life in to the game.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												This game is AWESOME!!!I had high hopes for this game as i have owned other titles in this series, but WOW!. The graphics are great, everything i expected and more. Lots of visibly moving parts on the implements, even the heat cloud from the exhaust pipe on the tractors.I have only played a couple hours, I can't wait to get the larger equipment!I pre-ordered this for a discount but its well worth the full price.10/10EDIT 11/5/2014I know there will be more content and mods added to this, but after further play time, I wish there was more. Only 2 maps at the moment and one of them is from FS13. And some of the equipment that I expected was gone...like the Big Krone ( 1200 I think ) Mower.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2014
												Few hours in, and for the price this is another great game by the developers.  Some of the equipment and one map is from the 2013 Titanium DLC, but I personally loved that DLC, so I'm not mad that they introduced them again.For $30 it's a fun game that I will spend countless hours on, as I did with the other games in the series.  My biggest complaints with the older versions (2011, 2013) were the physics and the Heads Up Display, and both of them have been fixed wonderfuly.Multiplayer is also going to be a blast with several of my friends.The visuals are pretty stunning, there's tracks on the ground where you have drove, and wagons will fill up differently compared to where the auger on the combine is located.

content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												I am a returning fan to the Farming Simulator Series.  FS15 is another great hit!  I usually play games like Far Cry, Crisis and huge deeply involved RPGs, however, I am completely obsessed with FS15... The graphics are improved over the older versions and overall it seems that the game concept has remained the same.  The base game is nothing special compared with the previous versions, but then again FS13 was really all about the MODS.  The only gripe I have is a slightly awkward selling point for straw that makes the entire process cumbersome.  That being said I am really looking foward to new maps and MODS from the community.  If you are not a graphic mongering zombie apocalypse shoot em in the face only type person, even if your are, this is a great way to relax and enjoy some time away from it all.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												It is difficult to understand just what holds you to this game for hour upon hour, with now over 2000 hours gameplay on Farm Simulator 2013 this version for 2015 is even better. When my family ask me what the attraction is I can't explain why I'm hooked. The physics is noticable straight away in 15 and the graphics have been updated too. Perhaps it is for me just a way to relax after the end of a day, but I still find myself working out the best to make a profit, but as the Sun sets and the Moon begins to rise I end the day standing on my farm cottage porch admiring the view.Now where did I put that pipe.

content:

												For all that are unfamiliar to the francis, in Farming Simulator you get a closer look in to the life of a farmer, like in real life the more work you put in to this game the more profit you will earn and with the money you can upgrade you farming equipment and buy more fields to run an even bigger profit and expand your farm. Keeping in mind that this isn't a triple A title, and they only ask 30$ as release price, knowing that i find that Gaints has done a great job in creating this game, it may not run on the same level of graphic like other games like Destiny or Diablo 3, but i think in over haul it looks fine as it is, simple but fun. So in the end it's all up to your preference if you gon like this game or not, it's not a story based game casual.What's new in fs15? The biggest thing will be the foresting, you now have a new way to make money by chopping wood. The next thing you gone notice is the upgrade in graphics, everything looks more polished then in FS13. Then there is more realisme added to the game, where weights are more important and to pull off a large trailer you may need a stronger tractor, then there is a power issue where a cheap tractor won't operate two pieces of equipment at the same time, so when buying a new tractor at the shop you really need to ask your self what you gone use it for. And yes!!! you now have the option to turn on/off the withering of crops, and you get rear view mirrors, nicely done Gaints thank you for listening to your customers.Now there are some low points to this game, not that they are game breaking but who knows maybe Giants read this review and acts on it and if not then at least a review must give it all right? *There is a new PDA system and its full screen, the game pauses and if you are used of playing FS13 you know how handy it was to drive and check the pda at the same time for prices or demands, well you can't anymore. *Missions, the got a new system now where you have to walk to a board and check if there are any missions you may want to do, sadly enough this can be annoying if your waiting for that one mowing mission or for a demand to popup, cause you have to leg it each time to the nearest mission bord.*Screen tearing, seams Giants forgot to add Vsync, now if your good with pc's then you can change that in your graphic card settings but not everyone is a computer wizard and a option in game can really make a difference.I was hoping for some Ski Simulator in FS15 but maybe Giants is holding that for there next installment who know, anyway the game feels addictive like all previous farming games and by the time i get bored with the vanilla game i am sure i can look forward to many mods to breath new life in to the game.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												Worth it on sale or if you want a slightly better looking FS13. Definately worth it if you want to be drunk near farm machinary and not have to worry about losing an arm. FS15 is a decent refresh of FS13, the new shaders are definately a visual improvement on the equipment. Forestry is a nice addition. That said, it is still full of hilarious FarmSimulator-esque physics issues and minor annoyances from lack of attention-to-detail (like the Log trailer doesn't unload correctly at the designed depot, so why bother with it?). While the tractors/equipment look great, the stock buildings and terrain/enviroment lighting continue to look as drab as they did in FS13. Custom mod/map support still is present (as it was in FS13), however it's also obvious it's setup for future DLCs (for pay?).

content:
Posted: November 18, 2015
												Farming SimulatorWhen should you purchase this - During a salePositives- Tonnes of vehicles to choose from- Extremely varied gameplay- Great fun in multiplayer- Extensive Mod supportNegatives- Expensive- Gets a little repetitive- Small Community- Hard to use claw controlsReviewEver since i bought my pc ive started to get into simulator games more and more id seen farming simulator but thought it would be pretty naff and boring but after i saw some gameplay and some friends playing i soon relised the game had a fantastic range of tasks from harvesting to feeding cows and now even forestry and was one of the many great simulation games.Yes your friends take this♥♥♥♥♥♥but its worth it its a very fun game.If your interested in machinery/vehicles the you wont be disappointed there is a vast range of each vehicle and implement type with a wide array of mods just itching to join them. There are so many great mods from stunning HD map mods with extremly realistic farms that blurr the line between real life and a videogame to harvesters and tractor. The mod support for this game is probably the best ive seen ive never been so compelled to dive into mods. Currently i have 1.5gb of mods for the game which is away expanding.If you have friends to play this game with it can bring many hours of enjoyment. But in my opinion without friends this game becomes lonely and stale. The controls for the game are brilliant even with a keyboard and mouse the only bad thing about the controls are the clamp tools that are manly used in forestry i found them far to annoying and very hard to use.In conclusion FS15 is a great game to play with friends with an extensive range of mods. Great graphics and great controls. The only problem is the community on steam is quite small with few discussions and i find it really hard to meet someone to play multiplayer with. This game is worth a buy but i would hold out for a sale as £20 is a bit steep considering its been the same price since launch late 2014 and the farming sim franchise will be expanding to FS17 by the end of 2016.Rating  : 7/10

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												Good points but some bad points that were in FS13 yet they are in the new title.Graphics: Fantastic! we now have quality the matchs todays tech'. ..I'm afraid thats about it as the game is just FS13 with next-gen graphics. how?heres how.Same basic support for G27, (not all buttons can be used, force feed back etc)Same lack of engine scripting (ingition etc)same basic control (no need for brakes as you stop as soon as you get of the throttle nearly)Same lack of view command (snap look etc)same simple, basic maps (not to worry as the community will sort this)So in short we have Farm Sim 13 with a make-over and some new tools etc. but I may be let down by the base game yet I know in 6 months to a year the talent of the community will turn this into a top class game. THAT i cannot wait for. then ill really enjoy the game. Recommend? ..yes, right now? neh..Go get em modders!Boo developers!  V'

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												A lot of people laughed at this game, and so did I. Then I tried it out of curiousity, and promptly lost a couple of days in it.You need to play this game as you would minecraft. It's kind of a zen thing, you do repetitive tasks, but it's really compelling in a strange way, and it sucks up so much time and you know you should go to bed but you just want to go back and do _one_more_thing.The graphics are decent for a game of this time. The mud effects on vehicles are nice, and the lighting is good. Skyboxes are very pretty. Vehicles are amazingly detailed, every time I buy a new one I spend a good couple of minutes just looking at all the work they put into the model. The environment textures are relatively low-res, which is a shame.The driving physics are... adequate. They're not great, but you don't really notice when you're playing. It's not like OMSI or ETS2, where you are really into the driving aspect of the game. That isn't really the point here. I'd like to see some improvements, though.The forestry physics are... surprisingly good. They're still quite buggy, but compared to other simulator titles, they're pretty damn good. It's perfectly functional and enjoyable, but not exceptional.Sound design is good, the vehicle sounds are surprisingly nuanced, and you can hear the engine and transmission system working independently of each other. The environment sounds are just lovely, with animals, wind noises, planes passing overhead... It's quite immersive. For me, sound design like this is lacking in a lot of games. It's no OMSI, but it's better than ETS2, and this is a core part of the game's immersion in my opinion.Overall I definitely recommend trying it, especially if you enjoy resource gathering games where you can just zone out and relax, like Minecraft or Terraria.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												Good points but some bad points that were in FS13 yet they are in the new title.Graphics: Fantastic! we now have quality the matchs todays tech'. ..I'm afraid thats about it as the game is just FS13 with next-gen graphics. how?heres how.Same basic support for G27, (not all buttons can be used, force feed back etc)Same lack of engine scripting (ingition etc)same basic control (no need for brakes as you stop as soon as you get of the throttle nearly)Same lack of view command (snap look etc)same simple, basic maps (not to worry as the community will sort this)So in short we have Farm Sim 13 with a make-over and some new tools etc. but I may be let down by the base game yet I know in 6 months to a year the talent of the community will turn this into a top class game. THAT i cannot wait for. then ill really enjoy the game. Recommend? ..yes, right now? neh..Go get em modders!Boo developers!  V'

												Alot of flaws.  The hired worker often gets stuck and the fields do not lend enough space to manauver large machinery.  Also when time is sped up the hired workers seem to cost more but the job is not sped up. content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Excellent launch+ Runs very smooth at 1920x1080 8xAA and AF on my i7-3770K w/ a GTX670+ Added feature of logging+ Attention to detail on equipment effects+ Far superior graphics compared to FS 2013+ Interesting map+ AI can now do some of the things you had to do manually in 2013+ If a tree is in the way, can cut it down and destroy its stump+ Can turn off withering- Occasional crash when cutting wood with a chainsaw- Logging needs balancing- After finding 10 coins, locations of the other 90 are revealed on the map- Ground is so rough always getting implements stuck in the ground when trying to manage timber- Game pauses when bringing up PDA- No history for income sheet- Similar implements have different controls making it very frustrating to use some of the forestry tools- Many of the pieces of equipment from the previous version not included

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												Certainly worth the price. FS13 was good,  this one is even better. if you played FS13 here are the improvments you'll notice imidiatly:Graphics,  just got a lot better. one of the nicest effects is that the the tools and the vichles will now accumulate dirt as you work with them. if FS13 was butiful, this one is stunning.Physics, this is just amazing. I haven't played many games with such good physics. I dare saying that it is in a similar level as the AAA driving games.  it dose feel very real now. you really have to be careful now when driving.Maps, are identical in the layout. but the new graphics and the new terreain details makes these almost completly diffrent.Missions,  no more mowing for hours just so you can afford a new tractor. there are farmer missions such as 'bring me 10k wheat' and so on. but you will likely choose woodcuting as your initial source of income.Woodcutting, if you ignore the many exploite with this new addition. woodcutting can be very rewarding for the effort. and it is fun,

content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												As of writing this small review, I have logged only 5 hrs. First off let me say that I did not feel as if I played 5 hrs, I figured that I only played 2. This is a fun and enjoyable game that you can very likely lose many hours too. My suggestion to all who are on the fence about trying this game would be to give it a try, if you have time to burn hehe. I was one of those people that could not understand how my brother could enjoy such a boring game as FS13... that is until he dared me to give the demo a try, that was when I was hooked. So far I have only experianced minor bugs and glitches, but not enough to destroy the game for me. My honest opinion is that this game is well worth the price, even if you feel like it is only a slightly better version of FS13.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Drove my tractor into a lake trying to sell logs.   20/10 would submerge againOk, since 1/3 people found this helpful, I'm going to be serious now.    Farming Simulator is one of those games that looks stupid at first, but, you open it up, harvest your first field. Hey, maybe you hate it at first, but as soon as you harvest your field 4-5 times and you buy a new one, you lose track of time, you look at the clock and relize you've played the game for 12 hours straight. then you play More... More,,, MOAR!!! Until you have played it for 508 hours and your friends think you lack a life and brain cells/The Good:Every tractor, implement, and combine is modeled so beautifly that you can stare at them for 10 minuted before you relize that you should call 911 because the ramen you but on the stove has set your couch on fire.Any fans from farming simulator 2013 will be amazed at everything the game has to offer, especially forestry.Bjornhold is amazingGiants LOVES modding, so it is extremely easy to install and make modsThe Bad:Stick to Easy or Normal mode because Hard is like Grind Fest 2015I dont think tractors just bounce off of trees, cars, or buildings without a care in the world in real lifeMultiplayer barely works lag freeThe UGLY8.99 for a combine harvester?! I DONT THINK SO (sorry for caps)I hope you enjoyed, i have been putting off that buring stove for far too long.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												What game is it : Farming Simulator 2015What is it comparable to : A McDonalds Happy MealI choose to give this game a not recomended, simply because it is like, a Happy Meal..You get in and are hungry, pay for your product and sit down and go on board , but, just like with a Happy Meal, this game only satisfy your hunger for so long.After a few hours, you're there again, still hungry, and the same goes here.. There is simply not really enough "worth" of game play in this..Sure you can expand, buy new fields and such.. But in the end, that is only so much fun.For the achivements, they can pretty much all be done within an afternoons worth of game play..You have no say in how your farm is going to be, all is placed beforehand, and you cant even enter your own house to pass the night time.What would make this game more enjoyable to play?Well, an idea would maybe be that you start out small.. A house and a garage, and then slowly you can buy more and more storage and such.But as it is now, it's simply not worth the money nor the time..There's simply not enough variety in the game.. Just like an Happy Meal from McDonalds ..

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
												TLDR:  This is a cool tractor driving simulator, it is not an in-depth 'run a farming business' simulator.  Don't buy if you are looking for the economic depth of something like Tropico...I bought this game based on the reviews here, knowing that the majority of what people were talking about was the cool tractor driving, and assuming that surely there was an underlying economic business model behind the running of the farm.  Unfortunately, I was wrong in that assumption, and hence I only played the game for a few hours and won't be returning to it.  If all you are looking for is a cool tractor driving simulator, then cool, enjoy.  But, if you are looking for something where you can dig down in a ledger and see what fields have been producing well, what's the impact of fertilizing to the bottom line, how does the return on investment in the fields compare to the return on investment of buying bee houses or lettuce houses, etc, then this isnt the game for you.  The accounting ledger is extremely simple, doesn't allow you to see where all the in/outflows go, and doesn't allow you to see any history.  This may be a fun game for some, but it lacks the depth that I was hoping for, and I just wanted to warn others like myself.  Peace.

												Even tho I like this game alot, compared to 2011 which was the last FS game i played, the differences are not huge, but improving, even tho, starting with a loan of 100k (atleast on normal that is), I feel the tractors and the tools costs to much, also you need to pay a good amount for using the thresher and multiple tractors at once to get the job done, for instance: we found out that using 2 standard sowing machines would be great, but the first tractor to even pull the second cultivator, costs about 160k, the money balance in multiplayer is awful, and to do side missions, mostly mowing and using a fork lift, the mowing seems okay money, but to do the fork lift missions, you need a tractor that costs 70k which is weaker then the first tractor and cant be used to drag any tools at all.+ to pay the loan on the side...7/10, GREAT GAME! but more tools/mods or fixing some on the money income/prices needs to be done for my part.

												Being a fan of fs2011 and 2013 I can say that this game has been improved by no end. I wont go into the improved graphics and engine as this has been covered by many. There are some niggly little things that could and/or may be addressed in patches (such as only one cruise control speed as opposed to 4 in 2013) and logging machines being a little bit awkward to use  - the chipper being nigh impossible.However, before reading any negative comments please note that most people who are saying its too easy are playing on 'easy' difficulty or making changes in the XML files to cheat. Like many games it pays to make your own rules in your own head - "i want to clear all these logs" or " that field needs to be join to that one"8/10 great game

content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
												I had experience on a farm so I thought I would give this game a try. In some ways it is a simple game. It is about micro management. Investing your money to make more money with your various farming incomes. 2 things really bothered me about the game. When you work a field you can hire a worker/bot to do the driving. The bot turns around outside the limits of the field which is not big deal unless other stuff is in the way. Also they have roads go by with bot cars so your farming bot gets stuck in the bot cars that go by. If there is an obstacle in the way the bot farmer will get stuck on that. If you want to do the driving that is fine but it takes time. I like having many things going at the same time but keeping them all going became a hassle. The second bummer was the time speed up you can use. It is good to have but the day and night cycle stay the same so you spend half the game farming in the dark which was no fun for me. They really needed to improve the path finding in this game so the bots don't just all pile up somewhere.If you like a management game this one you might like. It is a bit of a time waster also if you like that.The farming is European so there is no John Deere farm equipment. There are a lot of cool mods out there so you can have any thing you want but I was unable to make it work with the Steam version. The mods showed up in the menu but not in the game. Must want you to micro pay for those.

												Nice improvements over FS2013, much better physics and graphics are nicer too, it's nice to see several mods built into the game now (I won't name them see if you can figure out which ones they are).  GIANTS have also drastically improved the beacons lighting effect & resolved issues from 2013.The game SHINES when you finally manage to get yourself the Scorpion King, its a joy to use and very satisfying, defo the icing on the cake.Overall I am pleased with this release, however I would of liked to see interactive cabs and more dials respresenting actual performance of the machine but Im just nit-picking here.Nice to see MODS being released after DAY 2 :)SCORE: 8.7 / 10

content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
												Unfortunately, I just can't quite recommend this game. If there were a star rating, I'd give it a pretty neutral rating, but since there's no inbetween option, it gets a no. Here's why:Cons for the game- Very little help/ instructions. Almost none at all. This is the single biggest reason for the low rating. After all of the effort put into making this game, you couldn't add an extra couple lines of text? One example, balers. There are 2 types of bales in the game, each made from it's own baler. There is no description as to which kind of bale each machine makes, you just have to know. There are also machines and trailers that interact with these 2 different types of bales. Do these other machines specify which type of bale they work on? Nope! Of course not! Because adding a single line of text, even just a 2 word "xxxx Bale" discription would be too much work. Another example is a harvester, the Mex 5. I bought it when I had a little extra money and tried to figure out what it's for since, again, there was no description saying how to use it. I tried cutting different things and no results. Finally I had to look it up online to get an answer.-Very "hands on", you can hire workers for some tasks but not many. Alot of the jobs, including what I would consider to be some of the most boring, you cannot hire a worker for. Why? Again, given the scope of the game, would it really be that much harder to implement a feature that you already made on some other duties? Example, you can hire workers for some harvesters but not others. Beet farming looks like it would be the most profitable use of a field, but it takes 10x the work since you cannot hire workers to harvest them until you buy one of the single most expensive machines in the game. Instead you have to sit in the tractor yourself, with one of the narrowest harvester heads in the game. It took half an hour to harvest one of the smallest fields, compared to the under 10 minutes of letting a paid worker do it for me, and I only make about 2x the money. Of course even then beets take up much more room, 3x, so that means 3x the trips from the field to the market where you are selling them.I suppose those are the only cons that come to mind for me. However, they are nearly game breaking in my opinion. You can *almost* play this as a management game, which I would prefer, but too much of the game requires you to actively control the machinery. Also spending hours, and game money, trying to figure out what the machinery does because they could not be bothered to add a description, is just rediculous.Pros:... well I wouldn't say there are any, just some middleground "okay" things. Decent or better graphics, though graphics are pretty low on my scale of what makes a game "good". Some jobs can be given to workers, allowing you to do other things, or even nothing if you want, while they work. Yep, that's about it in the plus columb for me.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												This is a rewrite to this review. So...... Farming Simulator 2015 (Gold Edition):First off, my father was a smalltime farmer. I used to help him. He's been playing this game for a quite some time and has logged many hours and loves it. I only purchased it with the intent of playing online with him. However......I can't really give this game a good review. While it is somewhat playable, it is also laughable to even consider it as a simulation. First, you start off in a field with some equipment and your first crop ready for harvest. No tutorials (normal mode) and not a clue on what to do. So you basically run around checking things out, till you figure it all out. There's a small actions menu which can be confusing at times. Once you figure out the controls and the menu, you learn to harvest. Harvesting has a Minecraft feel to it (Never even played Minecraft!). The biggest issue with the game is rendering, which ties into the Minecraft feel. Crop renders in square patches and when plowing, some parts of the field don't get plowed right. Plowing and harvesting evenly is an issue, as well. You can "hire a worker", but expect to pay them on $3-4,000+ per field, which is rediculous. And sometimes, they're worthless. So, you harvest and either fill your storage with crop, or travel to businesses to sell your harvest. If you're in the negative cash-wise, you'll pay back your worker before making profit. If you took a loan out, you can pay it back $5,000 at a time. So you plow, wait, harvest and store or sell your crop to try to break even or profit, so you can buy more equipment, which is reasonably priced. You will get odd missions like mowing or forklift, mowing is okay, but the controls for the forklift are a pain on keys and mouse. By the way, took forever to realise not only did I need the blue tractor and forks, but also needed to buy the arms as well. WHAT THE HELL?! Couldn't just make it 1 or 2 purchases! Oh, and if you didn't ralise the weights are supposed to help keep your tractor from tipping and you so happen to tip it, no GTA style unflipping. Hit i for inventory/info and search for tractors owned. Then hit "Reset", which takes your equipment back to your farm. I'm sure there's more for me to nitpick at, but my biggest issure is paid DLC for a halfassed kind of ugly looking game that isn't really worth the $17 I paid for on sale. This game may be worth $5-10 for slight enjoyment. Don't expect a bunch of acheivements, either. Short short list. In conclusion, mediocre graphics, horrible rendering, nowhere near simulation worthy, lack of tutorials during playtime, overly complicated controls and ♥♥♥♥ing pointless DLC. For my time spent, I can give it 4/10. But even giving it a 4 is being generous. I'd skip it, unless you can get an easy refund.

												As a child, I used to help out in a pre-industrial peasant village, where every single farming task was done by hand in the scorching sun. This had given me an intense fear of agriculture.This simulator, with its depiction of convenient and powerful modern farming implements, has given me the chance to steadily face my fears and learn to cope with it.I cannot recommend this game enough.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												Perhaps the Very Best Simulator game out there. It's very in depth in the field management with abilities to expand into other areas of farming like tree farming, green houses, and even solar/wind farming. The game can be played solely as a crop farm, tree farm, animal farm, or as all types above. There's also a very active modding community which the game developers seem to pay attention to and add popular things to the game in updates and/or DLC.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												What a great, different and fun gaming experience. If you grew up around farms this game will bring back some good memories. It is also great to enjoy together with your friends or on your own when you are running a successful business in singleplayer. I especially enjoy the high quality of the 3D models within the game.I would highly suggest to look up the many free (!) mods for this game created by the community (vehicles, maps, placeables, game improvements, ...) - They really expand the gaming experience and give you a lot of new equipment to try out!Some minor cons I have found:- The ambient AI traffic is a little bit awkward in its behavior.- For high-end computers the graphic settings are too basic and restricted. (Tip: You can greatly extend draw, view and shadow distance by manually editing settings in the mapXX.i3d files found in the game folder using the Notepad. This should really be an option to edit using the in-game menu, though!)- Even though I don't operate real tractors, the acceleration feels a little bit too intense and fast. Steering could also feel a little bit 'heavier'.Besides these, I really love the game and I especially like the community supporting it with great mods!

content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												Farming Simulator 2015:This is without doubt the best farming simulation game out there.I wasn't sure about this game at first but it is definitely worth it. At first the game starts slow with little money and things get repetitive, but once you start expanding your farm it's much more exciting and fun.Pros:-Lots of machinery-Multiplayer-Attention to detail in the models and map- Vehicles have more weight-Vehicles get dirty and leave tracksCons:-It runs great but sometimes FPS will drop. (Might just be my system)Overall, it is a great game for just relaxing and doing some farming. I recommend this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2015
												I bought this for my 10 year old son loves these kinds of games, but then I played it to see what it was all about...At some point, I realized I had been playing for hours and didn't want to stop until my next wheat harvest was done, but wait, I just started the canola, oh crap, I need to cut down these trees because the hired workers are getting stuck, wait a second, when was the last time I fed the sheep, oh and...... Damn game will suck you in!I'm really suprised at how good this game is. There is an endless amount of stuff to do, and the gameplay mechanics work quite well. The enviroment is beautiful; at one point I stopped for a couple minutes to admire sunset, with dandilion seeds drifing by and the crop swaying in the breeze. Also, the 3d modeling of the equipment is extremely detailed. There are lots of moving parts, and it looks like every single nut and bolt is modeled on every item. It's all very well done. I never would have imagined that I'd be all that interested in this game, but it's really pretty engrossing.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												Their isn't much to this game. It's very low stress and relaxing. Put on some tunes, plow your fields, milk your cows or whatever you want to do to earn money. Then buy better equipment or more plots of land. Rinse and repeat. Logging will earn you the most money by far of anything you can do, however it's pretty buggy, at least it is on my end. I have to save and save often. I even have a tree that I had to leave on the ground  (part of it is actually hovering in mid air) because I was unable to move it once I sawed it in segments. So be careful with that. I have not tried The Scorpion yet, but the controls on the basic logging equipment took me the better part of two hours to hang of. I've pretty much just giving up on logging despite the money, and only use it as a supplemental income to pay for my labor costs and let my fields and livestock be my main source of income. If you're looking for a low stress fun little game and something that's very kid friendly this is it.

												First off i would just like to state that this type of game is not for everyone. If you have no interest in farming or machines you would not like this game.  This is not a bad game it has had small improvements over the previous one. IMO it should not stand alone as a new game. It does not have new maps. They put some new machines in and features. I can understand that people spend time developing games and deserve compensation. I just do not think that this game deserves to be labeled as a new game. Most of the features in it should have come out with free patches. I will thumbs up this game because it is different and not as intense as other games a relaxing game to play inbetween more intense games.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												I played this game for longer than I probably should have.  Strangely engaging for a while but this game has no surprises at all.  It's exactly what it looks like, exactly what you think it is.  Here are some good things:  * Realistic looking equipment.  I wouldn't know how accurate this stuff is, but it's how I imagine this stuff would look.  Very fine details.  * Time destroyer.  If you have too much free time on your hands, you can waste quite a lot of it here.  *  A wide range of farming and farming related equipment to admire.  Now for my many gripes:  * The AI gets stuck on anything and everything.  They can't figure out how to back up and go around stuff even a little.  You really need them though, so you spend a good bit of time baby sitting them.  *  Buggy trees.  The logging is a cool part of the game, but often very frustrating.  Making my wheel loader flip 50 feet into the air was pretty funny though.  Really the whole process of logging could have used some fine tuning, or just a way to feed stuff into the chipper automatically.  * Cryptic.  The tutorials don't explain much and you are left to walk alone.  The store menu is pretty pathetic, they should have included more info on each piece of machinery and explained them a little better.    *Speaking of purchases, this game has a lot of DLC.  I can't find any mods on Steam, but there is sure a  lot of DLC.  Considering that buying new equipment is the ENTIRETY of the goal in this game, I feel that this DLC is especially terrible and stupid.  *Everything.  The "career" mode isn't a career mode at all, the missions are a joke.  It' s a sandbox with no goals of any kind.  I really wasn't looking for much in this area, but there is just nothing.  Once you've bought the best equipment there is no incentive to actually use any of it.  The game is over at that point.   This game is close.  It's so close to being actually fun to play, but I just can't recommend it.  Needs just a pinch of endgame, or plot, or something to keep it interesting.   Basically, if you really like looking at tractors, this is the game for you.  If you like grinding for hours toward a goal that is increasingly ethereal and pointless, here you go.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												Baah, you need to farm alot to get money.....Jokes aside. Here it is.Info:The game let's you take control over a farm with some bad quiality equipment. You have to harvest, cultivate, sow and fertilize the fields to generate income. This is done with the equipment and YOU are driving them. For a lot of boring tasks you can hire bots to do it for you, for a fee of course. Bring your friends and farm togheter. It will be alot more fun.When the cash starts to roll in you can buy more equipment, or sell of some old junk and buy better stuff. Or maybe a new field. The choice is yours.Pros:-Lot's of equipment to play around with.-a "#¤%load of mods are avaible if you get tired of the ingame equipment. (Including new maps)-Graphics are not incredible, but i'm ok with it. -A good balance between realism and dynamics.Cons:-A.I might be a bit stupid sometimes.-Wierd lag in Multiplayer (Might be my friends connection/computer. Still investigating)-To few crops.Summary:A really good game, especially if you are interested in farming. The pros are weighting alot more then the cons. 10/10 would farm again.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												EDIT: Changed review, see notes below.It was fun right up until I decided to do forestry. Then it went horribly wrong. Spent hours trying to get a tree into the wood chipper. It was like there was an invisble block in the way. I'm not the only one either, based on forum posts I've read. It's just not worth the amount of time I spent trying to figure it out. The rest of it is fun enough, but I can tell already that it will become a massive grind for very little point. Overall, I can't recommend it, to be honest. If, however, you're hard core into simulators then I'd at least suggest you wait for a really good sale.UPDATE: After playing some more, and finding a couple of forestry mods I am changing this to a recommend. The recent patch helped as well. Check around for various mods, they enhance the experience quite a bit.

It was like there was an invisble block in the way. I'm not the only one either, based on forum posts I've read. It's just not worth the amount of time I spent trying to figure it out. The rest of it is fun enough, but I can tell already that it will become a massive grind for very little point. Overall, I can't recommend it, to be honest. If, however, you're hard core into simulators then I'd at least suggest you wait for a really good sale.UPDATE: After playing some more, and finding a couple of forestry mods I am changing this to a recommend. 												Graphically astonishing compared to the previous release, the interface is also vastly improved.  The main map appears to be new but I prefer the large swaths of land available in the 'American' map... that being said, the autopilot provided by the 'Hire' button is buggy, either the tractor stops every few meters, or simply skips large swaths of the field.  The really cool tree thrashing machine only works with 1 specific type of tree (booooo).  Overall the gameplay is just as good as previous releases and I look forward to burning many more hours playing this game at least until I get all the achievements.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Farming Simulator 15 is a grindy and time-consuming game. You start with a small harvester and few tractors and work your way up to more powerful machines, that will make your work more efficient and give larger yields. Besides growing various grains you can also have animals (chickens, sheep and cows). Chickens don't need care, sheep need grass to eat and cows are the ones most profitable and also needs some of your time. Later you can specialize in producing silage - it can be mixed with hay and straw as food for the cows or used as fuel for the biogas plant. The choice is yours.If you liked Eurotruck Simulator or Elite Dangerous or grindy games in general, try this one out. It has basic tutorials about how to work your fields and what equipment to use. There are some good guides too if you google them. It's not a very complex game and easy to get into. In the game you can hire a worker to do the work for you (most of the time), but there are some tasks that require you to do them manually.I've played it in single player mode, even if the game has possibility for multiplayer. The DLC's don't add much to the game, as most of the DLC equipment have the same functionality than the ones in the base game. The Gold expansion adds a map and I don't have it, nor need it. There's a thriving modding community for Farming Simulator 2015 that will cater to your wishes.

												It's a good game, but it shouldn't be rated as a SIMULATOR.Let's get to the point why i've said that.First of all, the game UI is average and could be much better organized and displayed. Also, the scenery is very poor when it comes to interactivity with objects or places.Your crops grow in a matter of days and they have cycles, you just need to plant and crop, you don't need to check weather, time, soil, seeds or nothing like Sim Farm, where you had to check and decides lots of stuff even before planting.This game is not bad, but, for sure, it doesn't have the characteristics to be considered a SIM.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
												No I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone unless they were looking for exactly this type of game.  It can be fun, but it's one of those games you have to repeatedly start over on until you figure out the basics that should have been explained in the tutorial level.  Couple of things you might wanna know before hand.  The default harvester only works on wheat, barley and canola.  Everything else requires EXPENSIVE items that you can't afford from the shop.  No one will warn you against planting other things, but you can do it just as easily as anything else.  The '8' key speeds up time, the '7' key slows down time.  Note that construction will not happen faster if you do this.  It will only make the crops grow faster and animals produce faster.  You don't have to buy any animal pastures, you own them all by default on every map.  To buy animals go to the shop which can be found on the map when you hit the '9' key.  The animals are hidden away in the far right of the shop's menu.  Try not to sell any crops until their prices have gone up.  Only keep an above negative budget in the meantime.  buy chickens as soon as possible.  They're a nice easy source of income early in the game.  Apparently, you don't actually see all the chickens you purchased in the coop but they're there.  They produce more eggs as a result of there being more of them.  Even though you can't see more chickens...

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												What the hell has happened to my life?  Seriously, what?  A few short days ago I was just Average Schmoe Number Twenty-Six, working a typical city job in a typical city.  Today I woke up and threw on some flannel and some suspenders and topped it off with a New Holland hat and a can of FarmBoi Chewing Tobacco.  Yes folks, this is what you can expect from Farming Simulator 15.  I didn't know the first thing about farming, but liked the idea of building an empire in a small open world.  I'd seen some streams, and the streamers seemed to enjoy themselves...so I jumped in thinking it would be a fun diversion.Thirty hours of instant addiction later I'm an unshaven, scraggly mess of a man; swearing when I overturn my tractor and gathering chicken eggs in my spare time. Recently I've begun the descent into "silage," which is basically fermented grass that is becoming liquid gold in the era of biofuels.  Soon it will be time to graduate into cows and forestry, at which point I will have abandoned all pretense of city life and run off for life as a farmhand. It's been nice knowing you all.

number of helpful: 53 of 110 people (48%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												The current release of GIANTS farming simulator 2015, is really bad, and they obviuosly don't give a crap about making a nice simulator. The previous versions of the game had alot of things missing, due to a pretty low budget. But with the massive sales on Farming Simulator 2013, one would have expected them to do a really good job this time, now that they had the funds. They havent though. They've done quite the contrary to be exact. There is absolutely nothing new in the newest version of the farming sim, and im mad i even bought the game. It is basically just the 2013 with a bit more shiny graphics. They havent implemented one thing, of what their fans asked for,  and they should be ashamed of realeasing this product. Here a small list what they could have done, the last two years, but didnt.- Improve the AI. Make it able to do more than just driving back and forth. The AI Still can't drive on the road, and this totally kills the game, because you have to empty the combine by yourself all the time, leaving no time for anything else. It doesnt matter if you got 10 or a 100 fields. You can't tend to them, because the AI cant do a simple task such as driving on the roads, and unloading combines.- Physics is still♥♥♥♥♥♥ The Tractors handle like boxcars, and they also dont support any sort of damage system. So basically there is no consquence driving straight into a tree with 42 km/t. There we modders in the 2013 version that could do a better job, than the GIANTS team has done. [Im of course talking about the lovely More Realistic mod for those curious]- No new animals. Its still the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 3 animals, same as the Farming Sim 2013 version. There is no breeding or any of that sort, and only 3 animals. Really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ on their part again. Again, they had two years, but they accomplished nothing. Lets venture on with the list.-No advanced economy aspect. You're still limited to borrowing and paying money back, at a fixed rate.- The tractors still sound ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. There is no gearshift, just this one boring noise. They havenet even implemented manual transmisson and clutch. Something alot of people were hoping for. Afterall, this is supposed to be a Simulator. Also the tractors accelerates really weird. They're slow in the beginning, then they accelrate like they had a rocket on them. Really weird.- It is still not posible, altering the terrain in any way, other than cutting down trees (Big whoop. We already got a mod for this in 2013)This is just a few of the things they didnt do. Heres some of the things they did do:- Implemented tree cutting, which is very nice. But there is already a mod for this in the 2013 version. - Made AI worse. Now they wont even finish the field, if the implement cant fit on the last bit. This could have been avoided by making the tractor follow the edge of the field instead, but no.- Impoved graphics (Barely though. everything is a bit more fancy, and we got sidemirrors now. But really it doesnt matter. I would have picked gameplay instead over graphics any day)- Made it easier for people to mod their games. (Which is very nice. But im worried they are trying to make people make their own game, releving them of doing anything else but collecting money, when really, they did nothing)-Improved HUD. But really doesnt matter. I'd rather they had improved the gameplay.So basically, GIAANTS took the FS2013 version, and shined it up a bit, and then released it as a whole new farming sim, even though there is nothing new in it, at all. And they used two years doing this. Two years and they got nothing. It's very clear they dont give a flying F*** about their customers anymore, and i'm sad by the state of the game, and their blatant disregard for making a decent product. I give this product 0 out of 5 stars, and i do not recommend anyone buying this. Have you never played the other versions though, you might enjoy this one, as everything is still new to you.Thank you.

												One of the greatest games of all time.  I've quit my job to play full time.  I believe that, with the right amount of dedication and practice, I can become one of the greatest virtual farmers in history.  ...But seriously, I've only just become aware of this title from a few weeks ago. This is completely different than some of the other games I've played in the past (Skyrim, FO: NV) and I think it's a great tool for thinking about the work that takes place around the world on a daily basis to help feed the population. I'll be playing this one for some time to come, I think.  If you're looking for something different than the usual, you should pick this up.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Farming Simulator is a great improvement to Farming Simulator 2013. Even though you will recognize the game, new features have added and both graphics and physics have been improved.Logging is a great addition to the game, and might be a good way to kickstart you economy, as long as you don´t invest in more than the absolutely minimum of equipment.I love the Farming Simulator games for giving me a way to relax and unwind whilst gaming, but still giving me enough of a challenge.Figuring out the mechanisms of the game are fun challenges, and lifting those logs on the the trailer is not that easy - especially not when you also have crops withering and unsold wheat in the silos with prices falling.The life of a digital farmer is both fun and challenging in Farming Simulator - and you get to drive big harvesters! :-)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Haven't played too many hours yet, so my first impressions will be the ones I air here in this review.One thing I really miss is a "scenarios" section where you have to battle some really great challenges like "get out of debt" or some other challenge that really takes ingenuity.I realize that there are more difficulty levels in this game, and I will try them all, but scenarios that you have to fight through would be really nice.Generally, I'm positive about this game, but not all is glorious:Pros:- The technology of the "beginner" vehicles is no longer ancient so getting up and running is faster than with for instance FS13- Improved graphics for sure- Physics are much better. now you can't just drive everywhere over hills and mountains (add to the realism)- Energy consumption of addons, again adds to the realism, and does make this game harder, meaning more paytime before you just get filthy rich- A new map - Forestry (haven't been there yet so can't say it that in itself is good or bad)- Missions don't pop up on your screen, you have to go find them (I know some people will argue that "but you could say they come as texts on your mobile). I like the fact that they don't pop up in my head and interrupt my gameplay all the time- UI much nicer and things have been toned downCons:- The tutorial does not cover the actual logging part which is very weird since that's one of the selling points of the game. - Not that many new placeables, actually the only new things are, very expensive, trees- In general, the farming items are the same. I know that they do resemble actual parts, so it's hard for the devs to "invent" stuff, but could add extra cars and such.- When resetting items they should be returned to "original factory setings" for instance when you've had to reset an add-on due to it having flipped over.- One of the BIG ones: Give me the option to build my own farm from scratch. Let me try to face the challenge of building a farm on my own land. I realize that this might need to have some "step by step" pre-determined sections wherer to place stuff or a terra-forming option, but being "given" this huge farm just takes a lot of the personal touch away.Conclusion:All in all, the pros clearly outweigh the cons so I definitely recommend this, also if you have the FS13 or earlier.This game presents some new challenges, especially with the power consumption of add-ons.Until of course you decide to get the "follow me" mod and other things that makes it ridiculously easy.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Farming Simulator is a great improvement to Farming Simulator 2013. Even though you will recognize the game, new features have added and both graphics and physics have been improved.Logging is a great addition to the game, and might be a good way to kickstart you economy, as long as you don´t invest in more than the absolutely minimum of equipment.I love the Farming Simulator games for giving me a way to relax and unwind whilst gaming, but still giving me enough of a challenge.Figuring out the mechanisms of the game are fun challenges, and lifting those logs on the the trailer is not that easy - especially not when you also have crops withering and unsold wheat in the silos with prices falling.The life of a digital farmer is both fun and challenging in Farming Simulator - and you get to drive big harvesters! :-)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 13, 2016
												Farming Simulator 15 is the first Farming Simulator I've played. While I have to say I'm somewhat impressed with the graphics, parts of the game are repetitive, such as taking crops to sell, or tilling a field. You can hire farm workers to do these jobs if you have enough money or your equipment is efficient enough.All in all, I'd say it's fairly entertaining, especially for someone like me who knows little about farming or the equipment involved. I was also surprised ot find a large part of the game is more like forrestry simulator, though I guess technically you can farm trees.Also, keep in mind, this is "Farming Simulator" not "Farm Simulator."  I was personally disappointed, after my first long day behind the manure spreader, (yes really in the game), I wasn't able to go home and knock my wife's remaining teeth out or commit incest. You can't even go inside your farm house.If you're looking for a simulation of farm life, you'll have to look elsewhere, this only covers the act of farming.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												Not just 'not recommended' but 'HIGHLY Not recommended'This was my first exposure to this franchise, and figured it would enjoy the support and growth of its previous installments.   It does not.  The game is IDENTICAL to the day it was released and lacks some key features one would expect of a 'Farming Business' game.  There have been a few DLCs released for purchase, but they ONLY contain more of the same equipment or mabe in the future a new map.  No new functionality!There is a large modding community, but byand large from what I can see they never moved on to FS15, choosing to stay with previous FS...which I can understand as the games are pretty well identical except for logging.  As such the modding community for FS15 is pretty much just specialized equipment and a few handy mods for field management.  But no large scale overhauls to introduce anything you would associate with a 'Farming Simulator' such as need for any Herbicide, crop rotation, soil quality, or even an effect of weather on harvesting or planting.Seriously.  Just skip this one.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												I give a thumbs up to the "Farming Simulator" franchise.The reasons are:1- Its absolutly relaxing gameplay, the closest you can get to nature without leaving the house.2- It is by far the most deep game that can still be played "passivly", meaning you can fullfil other life duties such as reading/ studying and still enjoy this game in the background.3- Has enough activities to engage you when you have more time and choose to play more "activly".4- Even provides multiplayer to enjoy with friends!5- Very educational for urban people like me who never even knew a thing or 2 about farming.I will gladly recommend all the versions even today: 2011, 2013, 2015 every game has a set of achievments and the older it is the more basic the gameplay is. So if you are new to the franchise you can happily start from the oldest one but if you are looking for eye candy of course the newer look better ;)

number of helpful: 10 of 23 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Farming simulator have always been an oddball in the gaming genre.Its main appeal is playing with heavy machinery, and often you discover nice engineering techniques that went into the real deal.The coop part of Farming Simulator series is also great fun, and the physics will often throw you for a loop of laughs.At the present I can't recommend you buy the 2015 version of the game, if you fancy playing with a Farming Simulator game, you should pick up the 2013 instead and slap on some mods.At present, the 2015 is very unstable, and will regulary crash every 2 hours at least, without an autosave mod you will often lose a lot of work.There are no acknowledgement to these crashes by the devs, despite loads of crash reports, part of the problem is that it lies deep down in the game engine, and thus doesn't produce any errors in the log, and I guess they interpret that as "Oh there is no problem"These crashes happen on games that have zero mods as well, so they aren't a factor in the crashes.FS 2013 is stable, and the only thing that can destabilize and ruin it is mods, but you can fix that by stripping out the offending mod, it is much harder if the problem lies with the core game.Until there is a patch, I recommend you stay away from this game, or at the very least, only consider it at 75% or more sale.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												In Minecraft you can automate farm production and maintenance, and resource collection. (Granted you need some mods)Couldn't find a way to automate anything here beyond 1 worker working on 1 field. If I had 100 fields - I would have to have 100 tractors and endlessly press "H" key to hire workers... I believe gaming should evolve towards greater complexity and greater utilization of Artificial Intelligence technology. For a game like Farming Simulator - it makes sense that I am unable to achieve complete automation when I have 1 farm, however assuming I have all the farms on the map - I see no reason why I should be driving a tractor with a carriage to collect grain from EVERY HARVESTER EVERY TIME they are full.In my opinion a video game that takes such a hard stance against using AI isn't worth recommending.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												Once you've played one Farming Simulator, you've played them all.  They haven't changed the format for years and it's old news now.  Compared to how a real farm works, Farming Sim is very simplistic, where as in real life farming is damn hard work with a never ending list of things to do.  It's about maximising the potential of the farm and developing the business side. Farming sim is just plant reap, plant reap, plant reap etc, etc, etc, with tree cutting to try and stem the boredom.If you've never played a farming sim then get this, but make sure you cross it off the bucket list because once you've played one you've played them all.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
												First off: I love the game. It's pretty awesome concept, and very different from what people normally play. It's refreshing to play something relaxing and not intense like your usual FPS.I still don't recommend it though. Why? There are several reasons.The engine is absolutely, and I mean ABSOLUTELY atrocious. It's a joke for a game that came out in 2014. Even on relatively high end PC (i7 3770K and R9 290) I can't get stable 60 fps (and no, it's not my fault). Sometimes framerate dips to 20-30 temporarily when switching vehicle lights on (wtf?). Or by simply turning around. Sometimes when simply looking in some direction it drops to mid 30's.All of that in a game where everything but the vehicle models is an absolute joke. Trees almost look 2D with perfectly hexagonal trunks to give you just one of many examples. Actually, watch this: 


YouTube™ Video: [LS15] Elch Easter-Egg 

			Views: 2,036		

			Den Elch im LS15 gibt es wirklich.		

Draw distance is so horribly low you can see circles around you where textures change into lower detail (yes that's possible). Trees and anything else on the map simply suddenly pops in instead of fading in and out at least somewhat. Textures are so low resolution they change into blurry mess when you get closer. Sometimes I think they were done by an autist on some bad drugs in MsPaint.The company is very, very relaxed about releasing patches. The game IS (or at least it seems like it) under constant development, you get a DLC (paid or even free) once in a while, which is great, BUT the game is plagued by tons of more or less annoying bugs which get completely ignored despite being repeatedly brought up in the forums. What's worse, patches are only released once in several months.For some unknown reason the company doesn't use english as the primary language to communicate with the customers, and unless you understand german, you often completely miss out on very important stuff, for example upcoming patches. Some things simply ONLY appear in the german section of the forums. That's extremely weird approach from a company that releases a game internationally and whose employees know at least basic english (the company is swiss I believe).
